qas.question: What book did Eisenhower's parents read every day?
What Mennonite sect did Eisenhower's mother initially belong to?
What is another name for the International Bible Students Association?
What church did Eisenhower join in 1953?

context: His parents set aside specific times at breakfast and at dinner for daily family <a0_0>Bible<a0_0/> reading. Chores were regularly assigned and rotated among all the children, and misbehavior was met with unequivocal discipline, usually from David. His mother, previously a member (with David) of the <a1_0>River Brethren<a1_0/> sect of the Mennonites, joined the International Bible Students Association, later known as <a2_0>Jehovah's Witnesses<a2_0/>. The Eisenhower home served as the local meeting hall from 1896 to 1915, though Eisenhower never joined the International Bible Students. His later decision to attend <a3_0>West Point<a3_0/> saddened his mother, who felt that warfare was "rather wicked," but she did not overrule him. While speaking of himself in 1948, Eisenhower said he was "one of the most deeply religious men I know" though unattached to any "sect or organization". He was baptized in the <a4_0>Presbyterian<a4_0/> Church in 1953.
